summary_md: Last round: proved that nowhere density of S_P is independent of the root. Key lemma: for any saturated S, cl(S) and Int(cl(S)) are saturated (proved by transporting large matching balls and re‑rooting). Equivalently, gave a root‑free cylinder criterion: S_P is nowhere dense iff every rooted r‑ball F has an extension F' whose cylinder is disjoint from S_P. Hence nowhere‑dense status of any unrooted property P is root‑invariant. The meagre part remains open; proposed route: build a comeagre locally rigid Good_∞ via degree‑preserving marker gadgets, reduce saturations Sat(N) to countably many homeomorphic images plus ambiguity sets Amb_k, and prove Amb_k are meagre (or else produce a Borel selector on a comeagre domain). Note: the forget‑the‑root quotient need not be open, so naive quotient arguments fail. Citations: Current Proofs; papers/paper1.txt.
one_line_summary: Nowhere density of S_P is root‑invariant; meagre case unresolved.
highlights: Lemma: if S is saturated then cl(S) and Int(cl(S)) are saturated (proof by large‑ball re‑rooting).
Equivalent root‑free cylinder criterion for nowhere density: existence of subcylinders disjoint from S_P.
Conclusion: for any unrooted property P, S_P is nowhere dense iff the root‑free cylinder condition holds — hence root‑invariant.
The forget‑root quotient map need not be open, so meagre transfer via quotient is invalid.
Planned strategy for meagre case: construct Good_∞ with degree‑preserving markers and use Amb_k reduction; need explicit marker gadgets (Δ≤D and Δ= D, odd/even).
next_questions: Complete the Good_∞ construction with explicit degree‑preserving marker gadgets and prove each Amb_k (or Bad_{m,ℓ}) is meagre.
Either construct a Borel/continuous selector on a comeagre domain of uniquely marked roots, or produce a counterexample to meagre root‑invariance.
Resolve parity/scope technicalities for the Δ= D regular case and record cylinder non‑emptiness criteria.
